bibl.title: Hermesianax and the Tattoo Elegy (P. Brux. inv. E 8934 and P. Sorb. inv. 2254).
bibl.note: General data on versification in Greek elegy make the identification of the author of P. Brux. II, 22 with Hermesianax impossible: the Tattoo Elegy is the work of an anonymous amateur, not untalented but sometimes clumsy, from the third or early second century BCE.
bibl.seg: SLINGS S.R., Hermesianax and the Tattoo Elegy (P. Brux. inv. E 8934 and P. Sorb. inv. 2254).

General data on versification in Greek elegy make the identification of the author of P. Brux. II, 22 with Hermesianax impossible: the Tattoo Elegy is the work of an anonymous amateur, not untalented but sometimes clumsy, from the third or early second century BCE.
